SEARCH
Module org.klojang.jdbc
Package org.klojang.jdbc

Class SQLQuery

java.lang.Object
org.klojang.jdbc.SQLStatement<SQLQuery>
org.klojang.jdbc.SQLQuery
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable
public final class SQLQuery extends SQLStatement<SQLQuery>

Facilitates the execution of SQL SELECT statements. SQLQuery instances are obtained via SQLSession.prepareQuery(). You should always obtain them using a try-with-resources block. Here is a simple example of how you can use the SQLQuery class: 


 SQL sql = SQL.basic("SELECT * FROM PERSON WHERE FIRST_NAME = :firstName");
 try(SQLQuery query = sql.session().prepareQuery(jdbcConnection)) {
  query.bind("firstName", "John");
  List<Person> persons = query.getBeanifier(Person.class).beanifyAll();
 }

Here is an example of SQL that contains both named parameters and template variables (see SQL for more information): 


 String queryString = """
  SELECT LAST_NAME
    FROM PERSON
   WHERE FIRST_NAME = :firstName
   ORDER BY :sortColumn
  """;
 SQL sql = SQL.template(queryString);
 SQLSession session = sql.session();
 session.setSortColumn("BIRTH_DATE");
 try(SQLQuery query = session.prepareQuery(jdbcConnection)) {
  query.bind("firstName", "John");
  List<String> lastNames = query.firstColumn();
 }

  • Method Details

    • withNameMapper

      public SQLQuery withNameMapper(NameMapper columnToPropertyMapper)
      Sets the column-to-property mapper to be used when populating JavaBeans or maps from a ResultSet. Beware of the direction of the mappings: from column names to bean properties (or map keys).
      Parameters:
      columnToPropertyMapper - the column-to-property mapper to be used
      Returns:
      this SQLQuery instance

    • getResultSet

      public ResultSet getResultSet()
      Executes the query and returns the ResultSet. If the query had already been executed, the initial ResultSet is returned. It will not be re-executed.
      Returns:
      the ResultSet produced by the JDBC driver

    • lookup

      public <T> Result<T> lookup(Class<T> clazz)
      Executes the query and returns the value of the first column in the first row. The second time you call this method, you get the value of the first column in the second row, and so on, until there are no more rows in the If there are no (more) rows in the ResultSet. If there are no (more) rows in the ResultSet, Result.notAvailable() is returned.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the value to be returned
      Parameters:
      clazz - the class of the value to be returned
      Returns:
      the value of the first column in the first row

    • getInt

      public OptionalInt getInt() throws KlojangSQLException
      Executes the query and returns the value of the first column in the first row as an int. The second time you call this method, you get the value of the first column in the second row, and so on, until there are no more rows in the If there are no (more) rows in the ResultSet. If there are no (more) rows in the ResultSet, OptionalInt.empty() is returned.
      Returns:
      the value of the first column in the first row as an integer
      Throws:
      KlojangSQLException - if the query returned zero rows

    • getString

      public Result<String> getString() throws KlojangSQLException
      Executes the query and returns the value of the first column of the first row as a String. The second time you call this method, you get the value of the first column in the second row, and so on, until there are no more rows in the ResultSet. If there are no (more) rows in the ResultSet, Result.notAvailable() is returned.
      Returns:
      the value of the first column of the first row as aa String
      Throws:
      KlojangSQLException - If the query returned zero rows

    • exists

      public boolean exists()
      Returns whether the query yielded at least one row.
      Returns:
      whether the query yielded at least one row

    • firstColumn

      public List<String> firstColumn()
      Executes the query and returns a List of all values in the first column of the result set. Equivalent to firstColumn(String.class).
      Returns:
      the values of the first column in the result set

    • firstColumn

      public <T> List<T> firstColumn(Class<T> clazz)
      Executes the query and returns a List of all values in the first column of the result set. Equivalent to firstColumn(clazz, 10).
      Type Parameters:
      T - the desired type of the values
      Parameters:
      clazz - the desired class of the values
      Returns:
      the values of the first column in the result set

    • firstColumn

      public <T> List<T> firstColumn(Class<T> clazz, int sizeEstimate)
      Executes the query and returns a List of the all values in the first column. In other words, this method will exhaust the ResultSet.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the desired type of the values
      Parameters:
      clazz - the desired class of the values
      sizeEstimate - the expected number of rows in the result set
      Returns:
      the values of the first column in the result set

    • getMappifier

      public ResultSetMappifier getMappifier()
      Executes the query and returns a ResultSetMappifier that you can use to convert the rows in the ResultSet into Map<String, Object> pseudo objects.
      Returns:
      a ResultSetMappifier that you can use to convert the rows in the ResultSet into Map<String, Object> pseudo objects.

    • getBeanifier

      public <T> ResultSetBeanifier<T> getBeanifier(Class<T> beanClass)
      Executes the query and returns a ResultSetBeanifier that you can use to convert the rows in the ResultSet into JavaBeans.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the JavaBeans
      Parameters:
      beanClass - the class of the JavaBeans
      Returns:
      a ResultSetBeanifier that you can use to convert the rows in the ResultSet into JavaBeans.

    • getBeanifier

      public <T> ResultSetBeanifier<T> getBeanifier(Class<T> beanClass, Supplier<T> beanSupplier)
      Executes the query and returns a ResultSetBeanifier that you can use to convert the rows in the ResultSet into JavaBeans.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the JavaBeans
      Parameters:
      beanClass - the class of the JavaBeans
      beanSupplier - the supplier of the JavaBean instances. This would ordinarily be a method reference to the constructor of the JavaBean (like Person::new)
      Returns:
      a ResultSetBeanifier that you can use to convert the rows in the ResultSet into JavaBeans.
